an8.5:1.1: “Mendicants, the eight worldly conditions revolve around the world, and the world revolves around the eight worldly conditions.
an8.5:1.3: Gain and loss, fame and disgrace, blame and praise, pleasure and pain.
an8.5:1.4: These eight worldly conditions revolve around the world, and the world revolves around these eight worldly conditions.
an8.5:2.1: Gain and loss, fame and disgrace,
an8.5:2.2: blame and praise, and pleasure and pain.
an8.5:2.3: These qualities among people are impermanent,
an8.5:3.1: A clever and mindful person knows these things,
an8.5:3.3: Desirable things don’t disturb their mind,
an8.5:3.4: nor are they repelled by the undesirable.
an8.5:4.2: are cleared and ended, they are no more.
an8.5:4.4: they who have gone beyond rebirth <j>understand rightly.”
